intro: Litsea abraensis, commonly known as the Abra-laurel, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in northern Vietnam and southern China. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, woody drupe, typically containing one or two seeds. Litsea abraensis is often found in humid, shaded forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
